fi.sewsiaica.uusiaika.io

Class ReadFromTextFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.sewsiaica.uusiaika.io.ReadFromTextFile

  • public class ReadFromTextFile
extends Object
    This is a basic file reader that reads every line from a text file but discards the empty lines and the lines that contain a space or a hash sign as the first character. All the other lines are returned in an ArrayList of Strings.
    Author:
    iah1016

    • Method Detail

      • yankTextFromFile

        public List<String> yankTextFromFile(File textfile)
                              throws FileNotFoundException
        The method yanks lines from a text file. The yankees are transferred out in a String-List. Hashed or spaced out (comment) lines are excluded.
        Parameters:
        textfile - The yanking target.
        Returns:
        The yanked lines of goodness.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - Throws the FileNotFoundException.

      • isIgnorableLine

        public boolean isIgnorableLine(String line)
        Checking if the line is empty or has a space or a hash sign in the beginning.
        Parameters:
        line - A line that has been yanked from a text file.
        Returns:
        If one of the mentioned conditions is met, the line is ignored.

      • returnNewLineIffReaderIsClosed

        public List<String> returnNewLineIffReaderIsClosed(List<String> list,
                                                   Scanner reader)
        A fairly superfluous method for an earnest antimutator. Its purpose is to confirm that the scanner has been closed.
        Parameters:
        list - All them beautiful yankees.
        reader - Scanner that should closed already.
        Returns:
        If everything goes as expected (ie you are not an evil pit mutant), the method returns the list. If you are an evil pit mutant, null is all you get here.
